pros:
I can't speak for the company as a whole as I am employed at TMS in Edmonton. I can, however, say with all certainty that I consider The Seed the best place I've ever worked. The culture is wonderful and it truly feels like a family. From what I know, it wasn't always like this but upper management in Edmonton has made great efforts to really make this a place where employees feel valued and appreciated for the work they do. They do a wonderful job of keeping the organization's mission and values in mind while also cultivating each employee's strengths and gifts and making sure we are growing, not just professionally but as Christians serving our community.

Another pro is that management really emphasizes the importance of a good work-life balance and encourages self-care. They understand that working with the population that we serve can be emotionally hard sometimes and so, self-care is taken seriously and encouraged.
cons: Not necessarily a downside, but it's not always easy working with the population that we serve. It can be emotionally draining.

review_title: Good client programs, toxic workplace, unethical leadership
pros: Employees can gain good work experience and opportunities to move up or develop new skills.
cons: Toxic workplace, issues start at top level leadership. Leaderships perception of a staffs faith is more important than performance and toxic employees are just reassigned. There is shockingly little as far as risk management and training; for an organization of this size they’re lucky to not have had more serious incidents. The turnover rate (and lack of succession planning) of high skilled employees should raise serious red flags. Rumour, gossip and favouritism are habits at senior levels with negative trickle down. Change management processes are non-existant and employee communication is shoddy. Decisions are made based on ceos feelings, often without consultation or proper communication.

pros: Compassionate environment where you'll find many talented, kind staff looking to make a difference. The opportunity to work with a wide array of clients and issues is a worthwhile, meaningful educational experience.
cons: I'm hoping things have changed under new leadership, but the high turnover during my three years there made it difficult to enact major change and work efficiently. Like many non-profits, a lack of general resources can sometimes inhibit effectiveness of even the most well-intentioned efforts.

job_title: Street Level Worker in Edmonton, AB
pros:
I really enjoy and value the people I work with. We are a very tight knit group. 
The community members we work with are very honest and passionate. They look out for one another and are always willing to help those who need it.
cons:
Street level staff have a difficult job and see a lot of trauma but are not paid well at all. Living pay check to pay check makes it hard to be in a position where you can take care of your own mental health. 
It is difficult to find full time hours as a Street Level Worker since most locations are only open 3-6 hours per day.
